title: [ENH] refactor error messages on incompatible input
body:
There is repeated boilerplate in error messages related to handling of incompatible input. Error messages like the following are repeated across the code base, as well as the logic to generate the list of admissible inputs:
```
                "y must be in an sktime compatible format, "
                "of scitype Series, Panel or Hierarchical, "
                "for instance a pandas.DataFrame with sktime compatible time indices, "
                "or with MultiIndex and last(-1) level a sktime compatible time index. "
                "See the forecasting tutorial examples/01_forecasting.ipynb, or"
                " the data format tutorial examples/AA_datatypes_and_datasets.ipynb,"
                "If you think y is already in an sktime supported input format, "
                "run sktime.datatypes.check_raise(y, mtype) to diagnose the error, "
                "where mtype is the string of the type specification you want for y. "
                "Possible mtype specification strings are as follows. "
```

Varying parts are the possible mtypes, the name of the variable, and the tutorials this points to.

This should be refactored, optionally to a single error message producing point. This could be in the same location as `check_is_mtype` or `check_is_scitype`, options might be to modify those functions to return the message in `msg`, or write new functions which wrap the logic using some of the outputs.
